info.title: Ethereum JSON-RPC Specification
info.description: A specification of the standard interface for Ethereum clients.

methods.name: eth_getBlockByHash
methods.summary: Returns information about a block by hash.

maxPriorityFeePerGas.title: max priority fee per gas
maxPriorityFeePerGas.description: Maximum fee per gas the sender is willing to pay to miners in wei

maxFeePerGas.title: max fee per gas
maxFeePerGas.description: The maximum total fee per gas the sender is willing to pay (includes the network / base fee and miner / priority fee) in wei

chainId.title: chainId
chainId.description: Chain ID that this transaction is valid on.

v.title: v
v.description: The parity (0 for even, 1 for odd) of the y-value of the secp256k1 signature.

gasPrice.description: The gas price willing to be paid by the sender in wei

methods.name: eth_getBlockByNumber
methods.summary: Returns information about a block by number.

oneOf.title: Block tag
oneOf.description: `earliest`: The lowest numbered block the client has available; `finalized`: The most recent crypto-economically secure block, cannot be re-orged outside of manual intervention driven by community coordination; `safe`: The most recent block that is safe from re-orgs under honest majority and certain synchronicity assumptions; `latest`: The most recent block in the canonical chain observed by the client, this block may be re-orged out of the canonical chain even under healthy/normal conditions; `pending`: A sample next block built by the client on top of `latest` and containing the set of transactions usually taken from local mempool. Before the merge transition is finalized, any call querying for `finalized` or `safe` block MUST be responded to with `-39001: Unknown block` error

maxPriorityFeePerGas.title: max priority fee per gas
maxPriorityFeePerGas.description: Maximum fee per gas the sender is willing to pay to miners in wei

maxFeePerGas.title: max fee per gas
maxFeePerGas.description: The maximum total fee per gas the sender is willing to pay (includes the network / base fee and miner / priority fee) in wei

chainId.title: chainId
chainId.description: Chain ID that this transaction is valid on.

v.title: v
v.description: The parity (0 for even, 1 for odd) of the y-value of the secp256k1 signature.

gasPrice.title: gas price
gasPrice.description: The gas price willing to be paid by the sender in wei

chainId.title: chainId
chainId.description: Chain ID that this transaction is valid on.

v.description: The parity (0 for even, 1 for odd) of the y-value of the secp256k1 signature.

gasPrice.title: gas price

chainId.title: chainId
chainId.description: Chain ID that this transaction is valid on.

methods.name: eth_getBlockTransactionCountByHash
methods.summary: Returns the number of transactions in a block from a block matching the given block hash.

methods.name: eth_getBlockTransactionCountByNumber
methods.summary: Returns the number of transactions in a block matching the given block number.

oneOf.title: Block tag
oneOf.description: `earliest`: The lowest numbered block the client has available; `finalized`: The most recent crypto-economically secure block, cannot be re-orged outside of manual intervention driven by community coordination; `safe`: The most recent block that is safe from re-orgs under honest majority and certain synchronicity assumptions; `latest`: The most recent block in the canonical chain observed by the client, this block may be re-orged out of the canonical chain even under healthy/normal conditions; `pending`: A sample next block built by the client on top of `latest` and containing the set of transactions usually taken from local mempool. Before the merge transition is finalized, any call querying for `finalized` or `safe` block MUST be responded to with `-39001: Unknown block` error

methods.name: eth_getUncleCountByBlockHash
methods.summary: Returns the number of uncles in a block from a block matching the given block hash.

methods.name: eth_getUncleCountByBlockNumber
methods.summary: Returns the number of transactions in a block matching the given block number.

oneOf.title: Block tag
oneOf.description: `earliest`: The lowest numbered block the client has available; `finalized`: The most recent crypto-economically secure block, cannot be re-orged outside of manual intervention driven by community coordination; `safe`: The most recent block that is safe from re-orgs under honest majority and certain synchronicity assumptions; `latest`: The most recent block in the canonical chain observed by the client, this block may be re-orged out of the canonical chain even under healthy/normal conditions; `pending`: A sample next block built by the client on top of `latest` and containing the set of transactions usually taken from local mempool. Before the merge transition is finalized, any call querying for `finalized` or `safe` block MUST be responded to with `-39001: Unknown block` error

methods.name: eth_chainId
methods.summary: Returns the chain ID of the current network.

methods.name: eth_syncing
methods.summary: Returns an object with data about the sync status or false.

oneOf.title: Not syncing
oneOf.description: Should always return false if not syncing.

methods.name: eth_coinbase
methods.summary: Returns the client coinbase address.

methods.name: eth_accounts
methods.summary: Returns a list of addresses owned by client.

methods.name: eth_blockNumber
methods.summary: Returns the number of most recent block.

methods.name: eth_call
methods.summary: Executes a new message call immediately without creating a transaction on the block chain.

gasPrice.title: gas price

maxFeePerGas.description: The maximum total fee per gas the sender is willing to pay (includes the network / base fee and miner / priority fee) in wei

anyOf.title: Block tag
anyOf.description: `earliest`: The lowest numbered block the client has available; `finalized`: The most recent crypto-economically secure block, cannot be re-orged outside of manual intervention driven by community coordination; `safe`: The most recent block that is safe from re-orgs under honest majority and certain synchronicity assumptions; `latest`: The most recent block in the canonical chain observed by the client, this block may be re-orged out of the canonical chain even under healthy/normal conditions; `pending`: A sample next block built by the client on top of `latest` and containing the set of transactions usually taken from local mempool. Before the merge transition is finalized, any call querying for `finalized` or `safe` block MUST be responded to with `-39001: Unknown block` error

methods.name: eth_estimateGas
methods.summary: Generates and returns an estimate of how much gas is necessary to allow the transaction to complete.

methods.name: eth_gasPrice
methods.summary: Returns the current price per gas in wei.

methods.name: eth_maxPriorityFeePerGas
methods.summary: Returns the current maxPriorityFeePerGas per gas in wei.

methods.name: eth_feeHistory
methods.summary: Transaction fee history
methods.description: Returns transaction base fee per gas and effective priority fee per gas for the requested/supported block range.

params.name: blockCount
params.description: Requested range of blocks. Clients will return less than the requested range if not all blocks are available.

params.name: newestBlock
params.description: Highest block of the requested range.

oneOf.title: Block tag
oneOf.description: `earliest`: The lowest numbered block the client has available; `finalized`: The most recent crypto-economically secure block, cannot be re-orged outside of manual intervention driven by community coordination; `safe`: The most recent block that is safe from re-orgs under honest majority and certain synchronicity assumptions; `latest`: The most recent block in the canonical chain observed by the client, this block may be re-orged out of the canonical chain even under healthy/normal conditions; `pending`: A sample next block built by the client on top of `latest` and containing the set of transactions usually taken from local mempool. Before the merge transition is finalized, any call querying for `finalized` or `safe` block MUST be responded to with `-39001: Unknown block` error

params.name: rewardPercentiles
params.description: A monotonically increasing list of percentile values. For each block in the requested range, the transactions will be sorted in ascending order by effective tip per gas and the coresponding effective tip for the percentile will be determined, accounting for gas consumed.

result.name: feeHistoryResult
result.description: Fee history for the returned block range. This can be a subsection of the requested range if not all blocks are available.

oldestBlock.title: oldestBlock
oldestBlock.description: Lowest number block of returned range.

baseFeePerGas.title: baseFeePerGasArray
baseFeePerGas.description: An array of block base fees per gas. This includes the next block after the newest of the returned range, because this value can be derived from the newest block. Zeroes are returned for pre-EIP-1559 blocks.

reward.title: rewardArray
reward.description: A two-dimensional array of effective priority fees per gas at the requested block percentiles.

items.title: rewardPercentile
items.description: An array of effective priority fee per gas data points from a single block. All zeroes are returned if the block is empty.

items.title: rewardPercentile
items.description: A given percentile sample of effective priority fees per gas from a single block in ascending order, weighted by gas used. Zeroes are returned if the block is empty.

methods.name: eth_newFilter
methods.summary: Creates a filter object, based on filter options, to notify when the state changes (logs).

methods.name: eth_newBlockFilter
methods.summary: Creates a filter in the node, to notify when a new block arrives.

methods.name: eth_newPendingTransactionFilter
methods.summary: Creates a filter in the node, to notify when new pending transactions arrive.

methods.name: eth_uninstallFilter
methods.summary: Uninstalls a filter with given id.

methods.name: eth_getFilterChanges
methods.summary: Polling method for a filter, which returns an array of logs which occurred since last poll.

methods.name: eth_getFilterLogs
methods.summary: Returns an array of all logs matching filter with given id.

methods.name: eth_getLogs
methods.summary: Returns an array of all logs matching filter with given id.

methods.name: eth_mining
methods.summary: Returns whether the client is actively mining new blocks.

methods.name: eth_hashrate
methods.summary: Returns the number of hashes per second that the node is mining with.

methods.name: eth_getWork
methods.summary: Returns the hash of the current block, the seedHash, and the boundary condition to be met (target).

methods.name: eth_submitWork
methods.summary: Used for submitting a proof-of-work solution.

methods.name: eth_submitHashrate
methods.summary: Used for submitting mining hashrate.

methods.name: eth_sign
methods.summary: Returns an EIP-191 signature over the provided data.

methods.name: eth_signTransaction
methods.summary: Returns an RLP encoded transaction signed by the specified account.

methods.name: eth_getTransactionReceipt
methods.summary: Returns the receipt of a transaction by transaction hash.

to.title: to
to.description: Address of the receiver or null in a contract creation transaction.

cumulativeGasUsed.title: cumulative gas used
cumulativeGasUsed.description: The sum of gas used by this transaction and all preceding transactions in the same block.

gasUsed.title: gas used
gasUsed.description: The amount of gas used for this specific transaction alone.

contractAddress.title: contract address
contractAddress.description: The contract address created, if the transaction was a contract creation, otherwise null.

root.title: state root
root.description: The post-transaction state root. Only specified for transactions included before the Byzantium upgrade.

status.title: status
status.description: Either 1 (success) or 0 (failure). Only specified for transactions included after the Byzantium upgrade.

effectiveGasPrice.title: effective gas price
effectiveGasPrice.description: The actual value per gas deducted from the senders account. Before EIP-1559, this is equal to the transaction's gas price. After, it is equal to baseFeePerGas + min(maxFeePerGas - baseFeePerGas, maxPriorityFeePerGas).

methods.name: eth_getBlockReceipts
methods.summary: Returns an array of all transaction receipts in a block by block number, block hash, or block tag.

params.name: blockParam
params.description: The block identifier. Can be a block number, block hash, or block tag.

blockHash.title: block hash
blockHash.description: Ethereum-compatible block hash calculated from the Filecoin tipset

to.title: to
to.description: Address of the receiver. null for contract creation transactions.

cumulativeGasUsed.title: cumulative gas used
cumulativeGasUsed.description: The total amount of gas used in the block up to and including this transaction

gasUsed.title: gas used
gasUsed.description: The amount of gas used by this specific transaction

contractAddress.title: contract address
contractAddress.description: The contract address created, if the transaction was a contract creation, otherwise null.

effectiveGasPrice.title: effective gas price
effectiveGasPrice.description: The actual value per gas deducted from the sender's account
